issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Detaching a volume which is available (no longer attached) results in an NPE. This appears to be just cosmetic. [root@h-20 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-6EAA3F35 euca-detach-volume: error (DetachVolumeType): class java.lang.NullPointerException {code} [root@h-20 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-6EAA3F35 VOLUME vol-6EAA3F35 1 PARTI00 available 2013-10-25T00:00:01.293Z standard [root@h-20 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-6EAA3F35 --debug 2013-10-24 23:52:33,470 DEBUG DetachVolume parsed arguments: {'userregion': fields.summary: NPE attempting to detach an available volume

comments.body: Trying to reproduce this, it looks like a null valued object is dereferenced while throwing an exception with the correct error message. So instead of the actual error, the NPE boils up the stack.
Fix in a private branch, waiting for maint/3.4/testing to open for 3.4.2

Received the following response:

2014-01-23 01:38:20: DetachVolume: DetachVolumeType: Volume is not currently attached to any instance: VolumeId,vol-7C7C3B7F
